definition: to herd/to breed livestock/to govern (old)/government official (old)

pinyin: Su1 ge2 lan2 mu4 yang2 quan3

sentences.english: The pup looked to be a cross between a Lab and a German shepherd.
sentences.chinese: 看起來是拉布拉多獵犬和德國牧羊犬交配的品種。

sentences.english: At last the goatherd threw a stone, and breaking its horn.
sentences.chinese: 最後這個牧羊人扔了塊石頭打破了羊的角。

sentences.english: Cloud deep very despise the keepers of the later generations.
sentences.chinese: 雲深很不屑那個牧羊的後人。

sentences.english: And tried what she could, as a shepherdess should.
sentences.chinese: 試驗過的什麼她可以當一個牧羊女。

sentences.english: So the king ordered that the marriage of the shepherd and the princess take place without delay.
sentences.chinese: 於是王下令，該牧羊人和公主的婚姻採取不拖延。

sentences.english: A few years ago, all the Border Collies in a sheepdog trial would have been black and white or tricolor.
sentences.chinese: 幾年前，在牧羊比賽中邊境基本是黑白色或三色。

sentences.english: My lord, you are departing, and who shall feed this people?
sentences.chinese: 我的主，你將要離世，誰牧羊這民呢？

sentences.english: But there's another meaning given to shepherds as well.
sentences.chinese: 但是還有另一個附加在牧羊人上的含義。

sentences.english: These herding dogs help move and protect the animals.
sentences.chinese: 這些牧羊犬可以驅趕並保護這些牲畜。

sentences.english: With the help of two dogs, he drove the sheep down the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 在兩隻牧羊犬的幫助下，他把羊從山上趕了下來。

sentences.english: The Shepherdess said with no hesitation.
A shepherd lost the whole of his flock by a dreadful illness .
sentences.chinese: 由於一場可怕的瘟疫，牧羊人的一羣羊都死光了。

sentences.english: The shepherd guided his sheep down the hill.
GOATHERD hmarketing ci ampaign sought to recredined a stray goat to his flock.
sentences.chinese: 很多山羊被牧羊人趕到羊圈裏。

sentences.english: Its mountains are breezily cool and inhabited mostly by goats and their herders.
sentences.chinese: 山上，涼爽微風輕拂着，僅有山羊與牧羊人長居於此。

sentences.english: A few days later, the angel came back to thank the sheepherder and asked what he wanted.
sentences.chinese: 過了幾天，天使來答謝牧羊人，問他要什麼。

definition: to tend a flock of sheep/to let sheep out to pasture/fig. to throw off the reins/to leave sb alone/acting freely and irresponsibly
to harness a horse/to lasso a horse
